title: Sacraments as Privileged Encounters with Jesus Christ
subject: Theology

document.title: Doctrinal Elements of a Curriculum Framework for the Development of Catechetical Materials for Young People of High School Age

7CADE0D8476B40598E050E062CA89477.description:
The Sacrament of the Anointing of the Sick can
have different effects. Sometimes Christ does bring
about physical healing through that sacrament.
Other times, the healing is spiritual in that it helps
the person to be better prepared for death, to be at
peace, and to be eager to be with the Lord.

79651B3C6E034778BDD8051C02725411.description:
Each of the sacraments is effective whether we feel
it or not; it is sometimes only in looking back that
we can recognize how Christ has touched us and
helped us through the sacraments.

ACD2CE08BEDF40338A10A05DDAFABD30.description:
The effects of the grace we receive through the
sacraments is not something that can be seen
or measured.

27F35EDEDE834C92AA47A824BA68DE0C.description:
How do we know that any of the sacraments really
work? For example, if a person dies after receiving the
Sacrament of the Anointing of the Sick, does that
mean it did not work (CCC, nos. 1500-1501, 1503-
1505, 1508-1509, 1520-1523)?

35E92179F4254A6D973D1F0CA2399A9A.description:
Because of these differences, Catholics must not
take communion in Protestant worship services,
and non-Catholics must not receive Holy
Communion in Catholic Churches (CCC, no.
1411).

CE6B5CF197E64CA78BF7CAC888E55326.description:
Reception of Holy Communion in the
Catholic Church is a statement of belief in the
Real Presence of Jesus in the Eucharist and of
unity with all Catholics throughout the world
(CCC, nos. 1376, 1391, 1398).

46E2E9E726974A3C97AFD4D63B5A2FF1.description:
Because of Apostolic Succession and the
priesthood, Holy Eucharist in the Catholic
Church is the Body and Blood of Jesus Christ.
Churches without Apostolic Succession and
the priesthood do not have that gift (CCC,
nos. 817-822, 1411).

B044D5418EEC43E7ACA2BA3AD6A4542E.description:
Is there any difference between receiving Holy Communion in a Catholic Church and going to communion
in a Protestant worship service (CCC, no. 1411)?

A7D520E07B1D4508B13739C2E988724A.description:
Each sacrament gives a special grace (CCC,
no. 1129).

890770D942794EFAA79DBA5698895E34.description:
While the sacraments are usually celebrated at
appropriate or significant moments or events in our
lives, they are much more than simply celebrations
of those moments. They are personal encounters
with Christ, who acts through sacraments to help
us (CCC, nos. 1088-1090).

A5F17625D89D4630A93E7D5543DB19F3.description:
Aren’t the sacraments just celebrations to mark
significant moments in our life (CCC, nos. 1066, 1070)?

BF1096D0F2CB46028A45A9211485E898.description:
The sacrament also gives the assurance of
forgiveness to a truly repentant person (CCC,
nos. 1452-1453).

C2CDA031E38B4E7FBFD7A7BBE2637AA7.description:
People need to confess sins to face the reality of
the wrong they have done, and in and through
this sacrament, they can be assured of forgiveness
(CCC, nos. 1455-1457).

1D884574AB524C5D93B230DD9BEFA774.description:
The Sacrament of Reconciliation is necessary to
forgive grave or mortal sins (CCC, no. 1468), but
it is not essential for the forgiveness of venial sins
(CCC, no. 1493).

F9C06437CFDD48A2840DFFF3754A9421.description:
While God can forgive us however and whenever
he wants, he knows what is best for us and has
taught us through Jesus that he wants to forgive
us through the Sacrament of Penance and
Reconciliation
(Jn 20:21-23; CCC, nos. 1421, 1442).

24678027282240C098D417DDE64D1909.description:
Can’t God forgive us directly when we are sorry for sin
(CCC, nos. 1434, 1440-1445)?

9CBC54589B6D4662ADB390210BCE89F4.description:
Sacraments celebrate and strengthen our unity and
identity (CCC, no. 774).

3EE82BF639E348FEB42C3ACBBC4F008D.description:
Sacraments provide an encounter with Christ
which is unique and graced (CCC, no. 1076).

9DD24DAB1D2D4C1D9BBFAEAD1DFC38B2.description:
Any person can always pray directly to God.
However, God established the Church as a way for
him to teach us and to enrich us with his grace.
Jesus Christ gave us the Church and the sacraments
for our salvation (CCC, nos. 774-776).

9925125318BB46CC8DC3A6463141AEEB.description:
Can’t a person go directly to God without the help of
the Church or a priest (CCC, nos. 1538-1539)?

591B956AA0384F3CA8CCB67521A23952.description:
Reflective prayer on married life as witness to
Christ’s love (CCC, no. 1661).

FCE047DCCB804C739011EA8E84DCBE95.description:
Careful preparation for marriage, remote,
proximate, and immediate (FC, no. 66; CCC,
no. 1632).

D5D1A7EF4D954912AEFD193888914F60.description:
Praying for our lives ahead, asking God to
help us know his will and to follow it in faith
(CCC, no. 1656).

8ABC90ADD3FD41A3B4234AF0AA0C28B0.description:
Prayer for parents, relatives, and all who are
married (CCC, no. 1657).

6D241FB13EEB481E8E3D09F8B61BB2F8.description:
Gift of children and nurturing them (CCC,
nos. 1652-1653).

BB1DB87D68E947DA80A788E2605A3435.description:
Divorce, declaration of nullity, remarriages (CCC,
no. 1650).

77A89120E4AF4751BEE8C5E47E52F25F.description:
Ministers: the spouses before priest or deacon and
two other witnesses (CCC, nos. 1623, 1630).
(N.B. In Eastern Churches, the priest is the
minister of the sacrament.)

A90D165604F54560804DC0C5BFBC4F0B.description:
Celebration of marriage according to Church
law (CCC, nos. 1625-1637).

CEA78D57FBA545029E1A3B54835B7D8E.description:
Able to give free consent (CCC, nos.
1625, 1627).

9BDD423B1AD84F42A183092CA75ACF63.description:
No prior bond or other impediments (CCC,
no. 1625).

E01B4BEB9CCF48A184B1DE8CE52049F9.description: Help on the journey to eternal life.

08AE8E57BDFE401BB64B66F2805EE5DF.description: Help to live the responsibilities of married life.

F978E495A9C541BA8954F0733493BF32.description:
Grace to perfect the couple’s love for each
other and strengthen their bond.

DDE475556D3246F680376C06106A8918.description:
Consent given in the presence of the Church’s
minister and two witnesses (CCC, nos.
1630-1631).

82E4EEBD4B584CD4AAE960C68DE439B4.description:
Free consent of the couple (CCC, nos.
1625-1629, 1632).

7E8F4534F9044B2088BDED41107E11CD.description:
Mixed marriages/disparity of cult (CCC,
nos. 1633-1637). Conditions for permission/
dispensation.

BDA4EACDAD114F46A6B78A2BFDBAF613.description:
Scriptural basis: Jn 2:1-11; Mt 19:1-15;
Mt 5:31-32 (CCC, nos. 1614-1615).

D4AB337AEEFA4180B264120BBB348072.description:
Understanding the sacrament: Jesus raises marriage
to the dignity of a sacrament.

EA9B8A85A58A44648C171240B2CFBAB0.description:
Marriage: the sacrament in which a baptized man and
a baptized woman form with each other a lifelong
covenantal communion of life and love that signifies
the union of Christ and the Church and through which
they are given the grace to live out this union (CCC,
nos. 1601, 1603, 1613-1616, 1642).

7ED87DB7D6B84D99B3EB2823713F3296.description:
Offering help and support to bishops, priests,
and deacons (CCC, no. 1547).

F601DE5DA01840C295591C377AF752A8.description:
Praying for bishops, priests, and deacons
(CCC, no. 1547).

D0D80B71313540B4854A04B9235F72B8.description:
Prayer for more vocations to the priesthood
(CCC, no. 1548).

151388ED331D40BCB641893FBDAD00EA.description:
Distinctive ministries of bishop, priest, and
deacon (CCC, nos. 1594-1596).

9A6CB5E490F04786B69195C20CC284F2.description:
Servant leaders according to order (CCC, nos.
1547ff.).

17DA6086FBBC4DB9B1DF63CF641361C5.description:
Minister of the sacrament: bishop (CCC, nos.
1575-1576).

94CC1954CB44471E831069A52C6AAE77.description:
Servant leader in Person of Christ (CCC, nos.
1552-1553, 1548-1551).

DFCA5BD2E97C4ADA9BC61466E2792711.description:
Lifelong commitment to personal prayer and
devotion (CCC, nos. 1567, 1579).

F0A81AD76B4744A0AF3F6C0F4F0803AB.description:
Mental health screening (Program of Priestly
Formation, nos. 5, 53).

7D8B0589B9534BE391D0008EACAF3517.description:
Celibacy in the Latin Church (CCC, no.
1579).

F1DF2123BDCE4D5F99920A7457FBCAD2.description:
Grace of the Holy Spirit (CCC, nos.
1585-1589).

FD894D18E78E46D795CA56AC07A650DA.description:
Indelible character; this sacrament cannot be
repeated (CCC, nos. 1581-1584).

55F5F978AD6847C6933032F5BC5A723A.description:
To remember him, Jesus commanded his
followers, “Do this in memory of me.”
His Apostles continued to celebrate the
Eucharist as ordained ministers.

03F68C3FC5064467A1862A6A4B4741E0.description:
Jesus consecrates his followers at the
Last Supper (Jn 17).

AE9597137EB64BD2A8500E85E8FA53E5.description:
Scriptural basis: Mt 16:18ff.; Mt 28:19-20;
Lk 6:12-16; Mk 3:14-19 (CCC, no. 1577).

1974AB617C9349F8B8B9C148C6761ECD.description:
Holy Orders: the sacrament through which a man is
made a bishop, priest, or deacon and is given the grace
and power to fulfill the responsibilities of the order to
which he is ordained.

4EB729C2F32149BDA6424EB24D5F2DE7.description: Sacraments at the Service of Communion

D75315B5AEE64E078EC2CD3B39373A77.description: Prayer on offering up our sufferings to God.

9BFF86AB3CD14E6BA0D8CA98241BE2BA.description:
Prayerful reflection on the healing power of
Jesus Christ.

4B0B217617934EF687F7AC0078971F3E.description:
Appropriating and living this sacrament (CCC,
nos. 1522-1523).

7A2265D96E494FDCB0EB1C53248522A4.description:
The Lord Jesus’ healing power is still at work
in the world.

35BDBE56A1BC4C67B07F34716DEE3031.description:
The Lord Jesus does not abandon or forget us;
he is with us in all things.

47D5A6F155AE4B6E849B94D2B035A294.description: Preparation for passing over to eternal life.

2506271AE35A4606A3503E86FC94DC43.description: The restoration of health if God wills it.

7BF3A1E33C324625872B473EAA96BC0B.description:
Strength, peace, and courage to endure the
sufferings of illness or old age.

3636B7994AB44815AA74797A8A1113D6.description:
Union of the sick person to Christ in
his Passion.

B80A8B7CED0C48529242C2EAADEFA6ED.description:
Laying-on of hands; anointing forehead and
hands with oil of the sick.

4C8FF7ADF3D64A018055357DBF340516.description:
Christ institutes sacrament of the sick
(CCC, nos. 1500-1513).

39E4C34E39EC47299B29D344BA77ABDA.description:
Holy Spirit’s gift of healing (CCC,
no. 1509).

374931BF0C704CFA82E944AE977AB530.description:
Anointing of the Sick: the sacrament which gives
spiritual healing and strength to a person seriously ill
and sometimes also physical recovery (CCC, nos.
1499-1513).

1B9996E38DD0460BAD6B5DFA11469EC5.description:
Reflective prayer on contrition in its fullest
sense: sorrow for our sins with the resolution to
avoid future sin (CCC, no. 1452).

E60F17D9CA964375A932D2595D6ED900.description:
Prayer of thanksgiving for the gift of God’s
forgiveness of sins.

22323454C2514DEBBFBB94CF663BA2F0.description:
Appropriating and living this sacrament (CCC,
nos. 1451, 1468-1469, 1470).

888FE0B078424CBFB584425BF1D6833D.description:
Reconciliation with the Church community
(CCC, nos. 1422, 1443-1445, 1469).

F3E3F5EBB9FC4E9FB3ADDCBD906B2B8B.description:
Confession of venial sins recommended (CCC,
no. 1458).

77E12E2CB71447ECB642C0CC3FF7D9CF.description:
Confession of grave or mortal sins (CCC, nos.
1455-1457).

24A64CEB37244CC080BFED2660EEFF40.description:
Contrition, both perfect and imperfect (CCC,
nos. 1451-1454).

4E42F600F41F441D914608AD7EF3EEEF.description:
Spiritual strength to resist temptation (CCC,
no. 1496).

65D6B5BE21BF486597409B4F3F12E798.description:
Remission of punishment for sin (CCC, nos.
1470, 1496).

A97764C9B24141CBB7892E63226AA3E0.description:
Reconciliation with God by which grace is
received (CCC, nos. 1468-1469, 1496).

CB8B9DEB831D49F48C9DECB39AC439AD.description:
Acts of the penitent: contrition and firm
purpose of amendment, confession of sins,
penance or satisfaction (CCC, nos. 1450-
1458).

4DC9ACCA6BB44D0C9EA5B46B49115CCD.description:
Scriptural basis: Jesus gives the Eleven the
power to forgive sins (Jn 20:22-23). Examples
of forgiveness (Mk 2:1-12; Lk 15:11-32;
Jn 8:1-11; CCC, no. 1444).

36136C4927414272968C9B4A4BD5D872.description:
Penance and Reconciliation: the sacrament through
which sins committed after Baptism can be forgiven, and reconciliation with God and community can be
effected (CCC, nos. 1422, 1425, 1428, 1446).

02F762434C3B42D38B98B92A2CBDAECA.description:
Reflective prayer on the meaning of Christ’s
Death and Resurrection, and petition for the
grace to give to others of ourselves as the Lord
did (CCC, nos. 1359-1361).

280833EB6C9E4F7796DEA6C054DC0BD1.description:
Prayer of thanksgiving on receiving Jesus
Christ in the Eucharist (CCC, nos. 1358-
1359).

A9AB5D3ED1C84C079C325FFAAAB54E50.description:
Active participation in Mass where the Lord
comes in both word and sacrament (CCC, nos.
2042, 2181-2182).

3A6E4C66E85347099A5A29A418E54BE1.description: Nourishing Christ’s life in us (CCC, no. 1392).

495B2D7CF74F47DD85BE7C8C0A85E24E.description:
Love of God, neighbor, and poor (CCC, nos.
1396-1397).

E4B93EB7196A43E99128A08F50E180A8.description:
Role of extraordinary ministers of Holy Communion (CCC, no. 1411; CIC, c. 910 §2, c.
230 §3).

09F12A74E0794BB0953F2544F42B49E5.description: Eucharist two times a day (CIC, c. 917).

CE4DD133C3E84B809DF8EA6E20C13FF6.description:
One hour fast from food and drink (CCC,
no. 1387).

D31229C3CBFA47F3A9631E223C1DD398.description:
Baptized member of the Church who believes
in the Real Presence and Transubstantiation
(CCC, nos. 1376, 1385, 1387-1388).

061A5036F4A046938B5D01A38335246B.description: Commits us to the poor (CCC, no. 1397).

89E2DEE05237467DAAE2FD684A501E7D.description:
Union with Jesus and Church (CCC, nos.
1391, 1396).

5542FD7338514089BA1F4D4396A8EEAE.description:
Bread (unleavened in Latin Church, leavened
in Eastern Churches) and wine from grapes
(CCC, no. 1412; CIC, cc. 924 §§1-3, 926,
927).

B8265F57068046ADB77766FBE8A93C3D.description:
Roles of priests and deacons (CCC, nos.
1566, 1570).

2B117FA11B0B429783634917BAD33504.description:
The Eucharist is pre-figured in the Old
Testament, beginning with the priest-king
Melchizedek (Gn 14:18-20), Israel eating
unleavened bread every year at Passover,
and Yahweh providing manna from
heaven (CCC, nos. 1333, 1544).

6E697E43DC824DABBE87F2CE193E9E39.description:
Holy Eucharist: the sacrament which re-presents
in the Mass the sacrificial Death of Christ and his
Resurrection—making it possible for us to eat his Body
and drink his Blood (CCC, no. 1323).

1A481EF7E6DF4FE78889BE5FF56AECF9.description:
Prayer is the foundation for knowing and
following the will and actions of the Holy
Spirit (CCC, nos. 1309, 1073, 2670-2672).

E7FA7754DA354309B2FD9722BBCDEB1A.description:
Love the Catholic Church—the Church
that Christ began.

CF2073BF68814DA58CD3AA102CE41AF3.description:
How to know the Holy Spirit’s promptings and
actions in your life, with the help of the Holy
Spirit (CCC, no. 1694).

471354CD9CA54B3AA25EF09825405B96.description:
Appropriating and living this sacrament: life in the
Holy Spirit (CCC, no. 1694).

B2D8AE98B99B4209B8894C1D88857207.description:
Call to spread and defend faith (CCC,
no. 1303).

113143B89FB445C3A8CEDD823C33A94D.description:
Indelible character; this sacrament cannot be
repeated (CCC, nos. 1303-1305).

74755ACE85B944FAB4B13E0641476F4B.description:
Help of Holy Spirit’s gifts and fruits (CCC,
nos. 1830-1832).

A5D74D10E2744CE5B2368ECD46A88EA4.description: Saying the words of the formula.

7D063FC8BBC14EA28BD72C5FB9FDB93F.description: Laying-on of hands and anointing with chrism.

EDB202147A8147268E0CD549478A980F.description:
Essential elements of the sacrament
(CCC, no. 1300).

241A3F01F1CB4091916F9F91452B1DF7.description:
Eastern Catholic Churches confirm
(chrismate) at the time of Baptism and, in
some cases, administer Eucharist then as well
(CCC, nos. 1290-1292).

BD94705151E1463A9825657AEDD25AE2.description:
Rite of Christian Initiation of Adults (RCIA)
(CCC, nos. 1232-1233, 1298).

D62B8C69F31E4663BE14DDB821CBBB01.description:
The Holy Spirit descended on the Church
(Acts 8:14-17; CCC, nos. 1287-1288).

D7BDF1764D1948F4B408878DE031D3E8.description:
The book of Isaiah foretold that the Spirit
of the Lord shall rest on the hoped-for
Messiah (Is 11:2; CCC, no. 1286).

68CDB1B4412B43798C27D1973A0471BA.description:
Confirmation: the sacrament in which the gift of
the Holy Spirit received at Baptism is confirmed,
strengthened, and perfected for living the Christian life
and spreading the faith to others; in this sacrament we
receive a permanent sign or character so it cannot
be repeated.

080044975AAA439EBC3329AC43C779A4.description:
Turning away from sin and selfish actions;
ongoing conversion.

2248EA3798B049AE95C56A95554A9BF6.description:
Sharing in the Death and Resurrection
of Christ.

84E58B2697544B53B39D026CE975904E.description:
Prayer and reflection on the meaning of
Baptism (CCC, nos. 1694, 1811, 1966, 1988,
1987, 1992, 1997, 2015).

6D0519B1390848CEAEECE5722E5CBE58.description:
In pious practices: blessing with holy water
(fonts in churches and homes), sign of the
cross (CCC, no. 1668).

1DF31178F69940EB82F8755822E859DA.description:
In the Church’s liturgy: Easter vigil,
renewal of baptismal promises, sprinkling
rite at Mass (CCC, nos. 281, 1217, 1254,
1668, 2719).

B239531113FD41BBAE1B61E48F5946BE.description:
Appropriating and living this sacrament
(CCC, no. 1694).

D30DAA6C2FEC43DC87E08255594287C4.description:
Indelible character; this sacrament cannot be
repeated (CCC, nos. 1272-1274).

99B8824712874704BE6B7276963934D0.description:
Freed from Original Sin and all sins (CCC,
no. 1263).

30B1234772074363AC9F1E248D56EEB5.description: Die and rise with Christ (CCC, no. 1227).

4C4BAA8189D74410837CC5CAB9B8F004.description:
Saying the words of the formula (CCC,
no. 1240).

D41E89DB49024FC99D8FE3BF4814E5A8.description:
Immersion or the triple pouring of water on
the head (CCC, nos. 694, 1214, 1217, 1240).

F04D51662C4B4AECA2B07FFA6F8EF51E.description:
The question of infants who die before
Baptism (CCC, no. 1283).

69238CD6B16F46698EDC4A0390B81E0A.description:
The Sacrament of Baptism is pre-figured in
the Old Testament at creation when the
Spirit of God hovered over the waters at
creation (Gn 1–2); in Noah’s ark (Gn 7);
in the crossing of the Red Sea (Ex 14) and
the Jordan (CCC, nos. 1217-1222).

9123067DEC024BC996F38E60435BC319.description:
Baptism: the sacrament which is the birth of the
baptized into new life in Christ. In Baptism, Original
Sin is forgiven along with all personal sins. By it we
become adoptive children of the Father, members
of Christ, and temples of the Holy Spirit; it also
incorporates us into the Church and makes us sharers in
the priesthood of Christ (CCC, nos. 1279-1280).

9208F2CEA7504EEFA21DC83D30E89EC8.description:
Liturgical prayer and the sacraments (CCC,
nos. 1137-1144).

6923A4A9642F4C40AA0CBE1658C2692C.description:
Experiential sign of Christ’s presence (CCC,
nos. 1115-1116).

581575B0F7314BEA8047F35F8A5ECE7C.description:
Sacraments for healing and sanctification
(CCC, nos. 1123, 1421).

C053C5C6376B4394AFCCFDE49DBEA46C.description:
Christ acts through the sacraments (CCC, nos.
1084-1085).

6AB5544EA1DB43F6A5804C403FE2D49E.description: Redemption is mediated through the seven sacraments.

2A06C5F412DA4D4AA5CDFF717B4BB1BF.description:
The Church is the sacrament of the Trinity’s
communion with us (CCC, no. 774).

1E163D8AB55B4D58BE9703BD4FEE23C2.description:
The Church has a sacramental view of all
reality (CCC, no. 739).

551C9EB6CE6B4F44BAF491C39FC11DA1.description:
The Church is the sacrament of salvation, the
sign and the instrument of the communion of
God and all (CCC, no. 780).

9F262A0EF74D4A3E92D4ACDE6E7833D6.description:
The Church as universal sacrament of Jesus Christ
(CCC, nos. 774-776).

85D9BDE0E8BF4EC8871435A6F4BECA8C.description:
Jesus Christ is the living, ever-present sacrament of
God (CCC, nos. 1088-1090).

CD809CAA8EEB420CBFCE321F93C95669.description:
The Church and the sacramental economy of salvation
(CCC, no. 849).

409D67BECCB24F5C93047D662634AE17.description:
Sacraments confer the grace they signify (CCC,
no. 1127).

858722DDA8E843C6BA07EBE8AF15B919.description:
Eastern Churches use the word “mystery” for
sacrament and celebrate them in a similar but not
essentially different way.

3281D2C2A2D049D3A8C74109B439875A.description:
A sacrament is an efficacious sign of grace,
instituted by Christ and entrusted to the Church,
by which divine life of grace is dispensed to us
through the work of the Holy Spirit (CCC, no.
1131).

B5F74FF9A1604D289AF0FA182C8C472A.description: The Sacramental Nature of the Church
